citations.narrative:
All sale records are incomplete and do not include the following information required for purchasers who are not USDA
licensed: vehicle license number and State, driver’s license number (or photographic identification card for non-drivers
issued by a State) and State of the person. Failure to include all the required acquisition and disposition information in
records may impede the ability of USDA officials to properly track the movement and care of animals covered by the
Animal Welfare Act.
Each dealer shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the information concerning
each dog purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control,
or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer. Correct by ensuring that records are
complete and correctly disclose the required information. Correct by August 24, 2023.

The facility is not capturing disposition records of dogs on APHIS form 7006. At the time of the inspection sales were
recorded on a facility-made form and no completed 7006 forms exist documenting the disposition of dogs sold in this
calendar year, 2023. APHIS form 7006 is required to ensure complete and accurate record keeping for dogs. Correct by
ensuring complete and accurate record keeping and use APHIS form 7006 to record disposition for dogs who are sold or
rehomed. Correct by August 24, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(1)(iii) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
All sale records are incomplete and do not include the following information required for purchasers who are not USDA 
licensed: vehicle license number and State, driver’s license number (or photographic identification card for non-drivers 
issued by a State) and State of the person. Failure to include all the required acquisition and disposition information in 
records may impede the ability of USDA officials to properly track the movement and care of animals covered by the 
Animal Welfare Act. 
 
Each dealer shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the information concerning 
each dog purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, 
or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer. Correct by ensuring that records are 
complete and correctly disclose the required information. Correct by August 24, 2023. 
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility is not capturing disposition records of dogs on APHIS form 7006. At the time of the inspection sales were 
recorded on a facility-made form and no completed 7006 forms exist documenting the disposition of dogs sold in this 
calendar year, 2023. APHIS form 7006 is required to ensure complete and accurate record keeping for dogs. Correct by 
ensuring complete and accurate record keeping and use APHIS form 7006 to record disposition for dogs who are sold or 
rehomed. Correct by August 24, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
